mdRecord.dcterms:title: Queen Margrethe II of Denmark and Prince Henrik tour UVa
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Marshall, Michael
mdRecord.dcterms:description: From excerpt: Queen Margrethe II of Denmark and her husband Prince Henrik (center) are joined on a tour of the Lawn by University President and Mrs. John T. Casteen III February 18, 1991 on the first day of the Danish royalty's state visit to the United States. Third-year student and University Guide Michael C. Smith led the tour. The Queen met with former Senator J. William Fulbright, for whom the Fulbright Scholar Program is named, to mark the 40th anniversary of Danish participation in the scholar exchanges. The royal party also attended a lecture in Alderman Library's McGregor Room on Roman archaeological excavations in Morgantina, Sicily, in which the Queen's grandfather was involved and which are now conducted by UVa.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Press coverage
University of Virginia
University of Virginia. News Office
